subject: Psychology
title: Bandura and Social Learning
description: A 60-second lesson on Bandura and Social Learning.

hook.text: Children watched an adult punch an inflatable doll. Then they punched it too. They learned aggression by watching.

buildup.text: Albert Bandura's Bobo doll experiment showed that behavior can be learned through observation, not just reinforcement.

discovery.text: Social learning theory added a cognitive element: people observe, imitate, and model behaviors they see rewarded.

twist.text: This bridged behaviorism and cognition. Learning doesn't require direct experience â€” watching someone else is enough.

climax.text: Bandura later developed self-efficacy theory â€” the belief in your own ability is the strongest predictor of action.

punchline.text: You don't need to experience it yourself. Watching is learning.

quiz.question: What did Bandura's Bobo doll experiment demonstrate?
options: Children cannot learn from watching others
